page.title: 14LOCAL NEWS OCTOBER 1985
page.content:
Main stories in the local papers in October 1985 included:-
LOCAL POST OFFICE CLOSURES; The South West Bedfordshire Member of Parliament was leading a last ditch attempt to reverse a decison to close a sub-post office in Leighton.
TEACHERS STRIKE; Teachers in local schools continued strike action in support of their pay claim. Teachers fighting for better pay have been disrupting school activites for some months.
LOW FLYING AIRCRAFT; Villagers in the Buckinghamshire/Bedfordshire border area claime to have been terrifed by low flying military aircraft on training flights from Royal Airforce Stations in Oxfordshire.
